titleStmt.title: Moravian Lives Personography
titleStmt.principal:
Katherine Mary Faull, Principal Investigator Bucknell University
Lewisburg, Pennsylvania
faull@bucknell.edu

Christer Ahlberger, Principal Investigator, 2015-2018 University of Gothenburg
Gothenburg, Sweden
christer.ahlberger@history.gu.se

sourceDesc.p: List of Moravian Lives person entities with reference to persistent identifiers, using ML standard names

revisionDesc.change: Broke personography into files of 50 entries each. This is first file.
Branched to a Bethlehem personography hold file. Kept Fulneck here.
Updated responsibility list, added more names and fields

event.desc: baptized at Fulneck by Gottlob John Hauptman
interred at Fulneck by William Arme
interred at Fulneck by Abraham Taylor

person.education: apprentice to a broad-clothier for 10 years in Hartshead
person.residence: with the single man William Taylor at Cleckheaton

event.desc: baptized in the Church of England
received into congregation at Fulneck 3 May, 1752 (22 April, 1752 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Benjamin La Trobe
baptized at Fulneck by Johann Christopher Pyrlaeus
interred at Fulneck by Erasmus Miller
ordained as deacon at Fulneck by Johannes de Watteville
moved with the U.E.C. to Herrnhut
ordained as presbyter by August Gottlieb Spangenburg
consecrated as a bishop at Dublin by George Traneker and Thomas Moore
resigned all offices except that of Minister
ordained Christian Henry Rudolph, then Minister of Dublin Congregation, a presbyter of the Brethren's Church
interred at Gracehill by T. Mallalieu

education.placeName: Pedagogium of the Brethrens’ Unity at Barby

listOccupation.occupation: teacher in the Paedagogium at Niesky

listOffice.office: single brethren's and boys' labourer Dublin
minister of the congregation at Neusalz

event.desc: baptized in the Church of England
married Anna Joanna Foster-Barham at St Cuthbert's Church Bedford
ordained a deacon by Charles Frederic Reichel

listOffice.office: secretary of College of Overseers Fulneck

event.desc: baptized in the Church of England
proved unfaithful and excluded from congregation
married Mary West at St Wilfrid's Church Calverley
interred at Fulneck by Peter Syms
received into congregation at Fulneck 12 October, 1748 (1 October, 1748 OS)
confirmed at Fulneck 22 Febuary, 1749 (11 Febuary, 1748 OS)
sacrament at Fulneck 4 April, 1749 (24 March, 1748 OS)
advised to leave brethren's house at Fulneck
married Elizabeth Ubank at St Peter’s Church Hartshead
readmitted to congregation at Lower Wyke
reaadmitted to sacrament at Lower Wyke
interred at Gomersal by Samuel Frederic Church

person.education: apprentice in a cloth maker in Birkenshaw

event.desc: moved into the home of Christian Renatus von Zinzendorf with consent of John Nitschmann
arrived in Berlin with Christian Renatus von Zinzendorf
received into the congregation at Berlin
ordained a minister of the Brethren's Church
married Johanna de Seydewir at Marienborn
settled the inhabitants of Montmirail into a congregation
arrived at Herrnhaag with the French brethren and sisters from Montmirail
consecrated a Bishop during the Synod at Barby

listOccupation.occupation: teacher of music and French language in Jena. Taught Christian Renatus von Zinzendorf.

listOffice.office: minister and congregation helper at Bedford

event.desc: married Mary Wilkinson at St Peter's Church Birstall 26 April, 1723 (15 April, 1723 OS)
received into society at Norwood Green
received into congregation at Fulneck 12 October, 1748 (1 October, 1748 OS)
confirmed at Fulneck 11 Febuary, 1749 (31 January, 1748 OS)
sacrament at Yorkshire 4 April, 1749 (24 March, 1748 OS)
interred at Fulneck by William Horne
came to the Children's Oeconomy at Buttermeer
came with the whole Oeconomy to Smith House
received into the Great Boys Choir at Fulneck by Br Renatus
interred at Fulneck by Abraham Taylor
baptized at London 31 December, 1742 (20 December, 1742 OS) by John Gambold
received into single brethren's choir at Fulneck
interred at Fulneck by John Frederick Zander

listOccupation.occupation: worked with James Charlesworth in the merchant business

event.desc: baptized in the Brethren's Church at Bristol

listOffice.office: district visitor in Parish of St James under the guidance of the Rev T T Beddulph and Parish of St Michael
Association Secretary of the Bible Society
Secretary of the Ladies Association for upwards of 30 years

event.desc: consecrated a bishop at Berlin by David Nitschmann and Daniel Ernst Jablonski
baptized at Wibsey Chapel Low Moor
received into the Great Girls' Choir
received as an acoluth at Fulneck
interred at Fulneck by George Traneker

person.education: school kept by the Sisters at Scoles and Horton

listOccupation.occupation: kitchen work during the Unity Elders Conference

event.desc: baptized at St Peter’s Church Bradford 7 May, 1730 (26 April, 1730 OS)
married Isaac Stead at St Peter’s Church Bradford 7 October, 1750 (24 September, 1750 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Abraham Taylor
baptized at Fulneck by Benjamin La Trobe
interred at Fulneck by Peter Syms
baptized in the Church of England
received into the Single Sisters' Choir
married Thomas Atkinson at St Peter’s Church Birstall
received into congregation at Lower Wyke
interred at Fulneck by Peter Syms
baptized at St Peter’s Church Birstall 16 May, 1708 (5 May, 1708 OS)
married John Peel at St Peter’s Church Birstall
received into society at Little Gomersal
received into congregation at Fulneck 11 January, 1751 (31 December, 1750 OS)
sacrament at Fulneck 13 August, 1751 (2 August, 1751 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Erasmus Miller
baptized in the Church of England
received into congregation at Fulneck 13 November, 1750 (2 November, 1750 OS)
sacrament at Fulneck 6 May, 1752 (25 April, 1752 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Benjamin La Trobe
baptized at St Mary’s Church Mirfield 11 November, 1736 (31 October, 1736 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Peter Syms
interred at Fulneck by James Greening
baptized in the Church of England
received into society at Norwood Green
interred at Fulneck by Benjamin La Trobe
baptized in the Church of England
received into congregation at Fulneck 13 November, 1750 (2 November, 1750 OS)
interred at Fulneck by John Frederick Zander
baptized in the Church of England
interred at Fulneck by Peter Syms
married William Armistead at St Wilfrid’s Church Calverley
interred at Fulneck by John Rogers

listOccupation.occupation: washer at Sisters' House at Fulneck
cook at Sisters' House at Fulneck
housekeeper and cook in Single Brethren's House

event.desc: interred at Fulneck by John Rogers

listOccupation.occupation: governess of the Ladies School at Gracehill
governess of the Ladies School at Wyke

event.desc: arrived in Fulneck with her older sister Esther
interred at Fulneck by John Rogers
baptized at St Peter’s Church Huddersfield 5 November, 1703 (25 October, 1703 OS)
married Hannah Aneley at St Peter’s Church Huddersfield 17 February, 1726 (6 February, 1725 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Abraham Taylor
became a member of the Reading Society at Rastrick
married Hannah Scholefield at St Peter’s Church Bedford

listOccupation.occupation: surgeons mate in the Danish Army

event.desc: baptized in the Church of England
interred at Fulneck by J Smith

listOccupation.occupation: teacher in the children's school at Pudsey

event.desc: baptized at St Peter’s Church Huddersfield 30 October, 1743 (19 October, 1743 OS)
married Hannah Sykes at All Hallows’ Church Almondbury
married Martha Price Griffith at All Hallows’ Church Almondbury
interred at Fulneck by C.F. Reichel
baptized at Gomersal by Benjamin La Trobe 12 March, 1752 (1 March, 1751 OS)
received into the Great Girls Choir
received into the Single Sisters' Choir
interred at Fulneck by Abraham Taylor
baptized at All Saints’ chapel-of-ease Pudsey
received into congregation at Lower Wyke
married Benjamin Brook at St Peter’s Church Birstall
interred at Fulneck by John Pearse Libbey
interred at Fulneck by John Beck Holmes
baptized in the Church of England
interred at Fulneck by Abraham Taylor
received into the society with her husband
baptized at St Bartholomew’s chapel-of-ease Marsden
received into Little Girls' Choir at Golcar society
received into Great Girls' Choir at Mirfield
received into Single Sisters' Choir at Pudsey
interred at Fulneck by John Rogers
interred at Fulneck by Abraham Taylor
interred at Fulneck by Francis Pugh
baptized at St Matthew’s Church Holbeck 18 April, 1717 (7 April, 1717 OS)
married Joseph Clayton at St Peter’s Church Leeds 29 November, 1739 (18 November, 1739 OS)
received into congregation at Fulneck 11 January, 1751 (31 December, 1750 OS)
sacrament at Fulneck 21 May, 1751 (9 May, 1751 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Benjamin La Trobe

listOffice.office: servant in the society at Holbeck with her husband Joseph Clayton
band servant of the communicant brothers and sisters at Holbeck with her husband Joseph Clayton

event.desc: confirmed at Hanover in her 14th year
entered Sisters' House at Gnadau with her sisters Anne Leporin and Charlotte Leporin
received into congregation at Gnadau with her sister Anne Leporin
married Christian Gottfried Clemens at Gnadenfrey
received as an acoluth at Gnadenfrey

listOffice.office: room overseer in Sisters' House at Gnadau
elected member of the congregation council
congregation service in Niesky with Christian Gottfried Clemens
care of the married brethren and sisters at Ebersdorf with Christian Gottfried Clemens

event.desc: baptized at Gomersal meeting house by Ludwig Frederic Wilhelm von Marschall 2 March, 1751 (19 February, 1750 OS)
received into the Great Girls' Choir
received into congregation at Gomersal on her sickbed
interred at Fulneck by Peter Syms
baptized St Peter’s Church Birstall 1 August, 1706 (21 July, 1706 OS)
married Grace Brook at St Peter’s Church Birstall 2 August, 1736 (22 July, 1736 OS)
received into congregation at Fulneck 5 April, 1751 (25 March, 1751 OS)
sacrament at Fulneck 4 December, 1751 (23 November, 1751 OS)
interred at Fulneck by Samuel Watson
baptized at St Peter’s Church Birstall 19 August, 1744 (8 August, 1744 OS)
received into Single Sisters' Choir at Gomersal
interred at Fulneck by John Frederick Zander
ordained as a deacon in Georgia by David Nitschmann
married Eva Maria Immig Ziegelbauer at Marienborn
consecrated as a bishop at Marienborn by Nicholas Zinzendorf, G P Müller and Friedrich von Watteville
married Maria Elizabeth (Martha) Miksch Jähne in Germany

listOccupation.occupation: assistant director of Orphan House Halle
head of Theological Seminary at Barby

listOffice.office: board of directors Society for the Furtherance of the Gospel
